intro: Pycnanthemum monardella, commonly known as sweetwood, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. Pycnanthemum monardella is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
